question: In order to assess the preventive and immunological effects of the newly developed hepatitis A vaccine, 7-year-old susceptible children in a village were immunised with the hepatitis A vaccine. After 3 years of follow-up observation, the results were as follows.<image 1> The main outcome of the study was
options: ['Incidence of hepatitis A', 'Prevalence of hepatitis A', 'Secondary attack rate of hepatitis A', 'Survival rate of hepatitis A']
description: The image is a table with two rows and three columns. The first column lists the groups being compared: "Vaccination group" and "Control group." The second column shows the total number of persons in each group, which is 500 for both the vaccination group and the control group. The third column indicates the number of cases observed in each group: 1 case in the vaccination group and 10 cases in the control group.
